definitions.definition: A device that controls the flow of a gas or fluid through a space, such as a pipe, manifold, or plenum.
examples: An oil refinery has an impressively vast number and variety of valves .

subdefinitions.definition: Such a device that admits fuel and air into the cylinder of an internal combustion engine , or one that allows combustion gases to exit.
examples: In nearly all internal combustion engines, the valves are of the poppet type.

definitions.definition: One or more membranous partitions , flaps, or folds, which permit the passage of the contents of a vessel or cavity in one direction, but stop or control the flow in the opposite direction.
One of the leaves of a folding door or of a window sash .
One of the pieces into which certain fruits naturally separate when they dehisce .
A small portion of certain anthers , which opens like a trapdoor to allow the pollen to escape, such as in the barberry .
One of the pieces or divisions of bivalve or multivalve shells.
One of the two similar portions of the shell of a diatom .

main_definition: A device that controls the flow of a gas or fluid through a space, such as a pipe, manifold, or plenum.
secondary_definitions: ( anatomy ) One or more membranous partitions , flaps, or folds, which permit the passage of the contents of a vessel or cavity in one direction, but stop or control the flow in the opposite direction.
One of the leaves of a folding door or of a window sash .
( botany ) One of the pieces into which certain fruits naturally separate when they dehisce .
( botany ) A small portion of certain anthers , which opens like a trapdoor to allow the pollen to escape, such as in the barberry .
( biology ) One of the pieces or divisions of bivalve or multivalve shells.
( biology ) One of the two similar portions of the shell of a diatom .
